title: Perform In Silico Toxicity Prediction
description: A computational chemist needs to predict the potential toxicity of a new drug candidate using a computer model before conducting animal studies.

tasks.description: Input the chemical structure of the new drug candidate into a toxicity prediction software.
tasks.expected_outcome: Agent successfully inputs the structure in SMILES or MOL format.

tasks.description: Run a panel of in silico toxicology models (e.g., for mutagenicity, carcinogenicity).
tasks.expected_outcome: Agent successfully runs the prediction models.

tasks.description: Analyze the model outputs to identify any potential toxicity alerts.
tasks.expected_outcome: Agent analyzes the report and finds a structural alert for potential hERG channel binding, indicating cardiotoxicity risk.

tasks.description: Generate a report summarizing the potential risks to guide future preclinical testing.
tasks.expected_outcome: Agent creates a report recommending a specific in vitro hERG assay be conducted.
